title: Introduction to 'easySdcTable'
text: given introductory demonstration function ProtectTable() enables easy interface statistical disclosure control package ‘sdcTable’ (https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=sdcTable). see input output functions sdcTable consult function ProtectTable1() underlying function ProtectTable(). Note ‘easySdcTable’ general ‘sdcTable’. package originally developed part modernization production key figures municipal activities Norway (https://www.ssb./en/offentlig-sektor/kostra). fictitious example data generated similar realistic data Norwegian municipalities variable names (unfortunately) Norwegian. demonstration based data example 2 package first use unstacked data. demonstrating ProtectTable() words possibilities.

title: Introduction to 'easySdcTable'
text: Method "Gauss" made default (See NEWS). additional method available sdcTable.

title: Introduction to 'easySdcTable'
text: Method “Gauss” improved zeros omitted input data. potential pitfall secondary suppression Gaussian elimination cases protectZeros = TRUE zeros omitted input data. underlying function, GaussSuppression, produce warning cases (introduced SSBtools version 1.2.2) text: “Suppressed cells empty input protected. Extend input data zeros?”. Cases warning occur now avoided within ProtectTable. Internally data automatically extended needed.

what: Another comment about “Gauss” and zeros omitted in input
title: Introduction to 'easySdcTable'
text: hierarchies supplied input (parameter dimList) exist input codes hierarchies totally missing data, still possible create situation warning: “Suppressed cells empty input protected. Extend input data zeros?”. behavior changed. Ignore warning codes represent structural zeros. , extend data zero frequencies (see parameter freqVar) code represented data.

title: Introduction to 'easySdcTable'
text: graphical user interface based ‘shiny’ can started : start gui example data catch output: start gui possibility run tau-argus: interface tau-argus make use functionality ‘sdcTable’. See documentation ProtectTable() information.
code: PTgui() out <- PTgui(data=EasyData("z1w")) exeArgus <- "C:/Tau/TauArgus4.1.4/TauArgus.exe" # Tau-argus executable  pathArgus <- "C:/Users/nnn/Documents" # Folder for (temporary) tau-argus files PTgui(exeArgus=exeArgus, pathArgus=pathArgus)

title: Introduction to 'easySdcTable'
text: function EasyData() ‘easySdcTable’ returns example data. unstacked data mean counts (cell frequencies) single column.
code: z2w <- EasyData("z2w")  print(z2w, row.names=FALSE) region fylke kostragr annet arbeid soshjelp trygd       A     1      300    11     11       55    36       B     4      300     7      1       29    18       C     5      300     5      8       35    25       D     5      300    13      2       17    13       E     6      300     9     14       63    52       F     6      300    12      9       24    22       G     8      300     6      4       22     8       H     8      300     9      3       38    15       I     1      400     3      0        9     2       J    10      400     9      0       32    20       K    10      400     4      2       18    11

title: Introduction to 'easySdcTable'
text: case counts columns four seven. Using dimensional variable first column can run ProtectTable :
code: ex2w <- ProtectTable(z2w,1,4:7)

title: Introduction to 'easySdcTable'
text: output element freq contains data computed totals.
code: print(ex2w$freq, row.names=FALSE) region annet arbeid soshjelp trygd Total       A    11     11       55    36   113       B     7      1       29    18    55       C     5      8       35    25    73       D    13      2       17    13    45       E     9     14       63    52   138       F    12      9       24    22    67       G     6      4       22     8    40       H     9      3       38    15    65       I     3      0        9     2    14       J     9      0       32    20    61       K     4      2       18    11    35   Total    88     54      342   222   706

text: output element sdcStatus cells coded “u” (primary suppressed), “x” (secondary suppression), “s” (can published).
code: print(ex2w$sdcStatus, row.names=FALSE) region annet arbeid soshjelp trygd Total       A     s      s        s     s     s       B     x      u        s     s     s       C     s      s        s     s     s       D     x      u        s     s     s       E     s      s        s     s     s       F     s      s        s     s     s       G     s      x        s     x     s       H     x      u        s     s     s       I     u      u        s     u     s       J     x      u        s     s     s       K     x      u        s     s     s   Total     s      s        s     s     s

title: Introduction to 'easySdcTable'
text: output element suppressed freq exception suppressed cells (“u” “x”) set missing (NA).
code: print(ex2w$suppressed, row.names=FALSE) region annet arbeid soshjelp trygd Total       A    11     11       55    36   113       B    NA     NA       29    18    55       C     5      8       35    25    73       D    NA     NA       17    13    45       E     9     14       63    52   138       F    12      9       24    22    67       G     6     NA       22    NA    40       H    NA     NA       38    15    65       I    NA     NA        9    NA    14       J    NA     NA       32    20    61       K    NA     NA       18    11    35   Total    88     54      342   222   706

what: Using named input and the HITAS method
title: Introduction to 'easySdcTable'
text: Now specify variables using names instead numbers. Furthermore use “HITAS” method. default method “SIMPLEHEURISTIC” possibilities “OPT” “HYPERCUBE”. latter possible cases two linked tables.
code: ex2wHITAS <- ProtectTable(z2w,dimVar = c("region"),freqVar = c("annet", "arbeid", "soshjelp", "trygd"), method="HITAS") print(ex2wHITAS$suppressed, row.names=FALSE) region annet arbeid soshjelp trygd Total       A    11     11       55    36   113       B    NA     NA       29    18    55       C     5      8       35    25    73       D    NA     NA       17    13    45       E     9     14       63    52   138       F    12      9       24    22    67       G     6      4       22     8    40       H    NA     NA       38    15    65       I    NA     NA        9    NA    14       J    NA     NA       32    20    61       K    NA     NA       18    NA    35   Total    88     54      342   222   706

title: Introduction to 'easySdcTable'
text: include tree first variables dimensional variables. detected automatically “fylke” “kostragr” hierarchically related “region” hierarchically related . Zeros suppressed primarily suppress ones twos.
code: ex2wAdvanced <- ProtectTable(z2w,dimVar = c("region", "fylke","kostragr"),freqVar = c("annet", "arbeid", "soshjelp", "trygd"), maxN=2, protectZeros=FALSE, method = "SIMPLEHEURISTIC", addName=TRUE)

what: Suppressed data with totals and sub-totals
title: Introduction to 'easySdcTable'
text: Now output data contain sub-totals additional variables secondary suppression taken sub-totals account. Since addName TRUE, sub-totals named using “fylke” “kostragr”.
code: print(ex2wAdvanced$suppressed, row.names=FALSE) region annet arbeid soshjelp trygd Total             A    NA     11       55    NA   113             B    NA     NA       29    NA    55             C    NA     NA       35    25    73             D    NA     NA       17    13    45             E     9     14       63    52   138             F    12      9       24    22    67             G     6     NA       22    NA    40             H     9     NA       38    NA    65             I    NA      0        9    NA    14             J     9      0       32    20    61             K    NA     NA       18    NA    35       fylke_1    14     11       64    38   127       fylke_4    NA     NA       29    NA    55       fylke_5    18     10       52    38   118       fylke_6    21     23       87    74   205       fylke_8    15      7       60    23   105      fylke_10    NA     NA       50    NA    96  kostragr_300    NA     NA      283   189   596  kostragr_400    NA     NA       59    33   110         Total    88     54      342   222   706

title: Introduction to 'easySdcTable'
text: output element info contains three parts. Since unstacked data extra variable, named var1, created. categories variable related variable names described. categories simply variable names. advanced cases possible single variable created variable names. Secondly, described tables(s) created variables. case problem solved using two linked tables. first table involves “fylke” second table involves “kostragr”. last part contains summary output two linked tables.
code: prmatrix(ex2wAdvanced$info,rowlab=rep("",99),collab="",quote=FALSE) var1                                                            annet       annet                                                            arbeid     arbeid                                                            soshjelp soshjelp                                                            trygd       trygd                                                            ==========                                                                            Variables Table1 Table2                                             1    region, fylke      1      0                                             2 region, kostragr      0      1                                             3             var1      1      1                                             ==========                                                                   Classes 'safeObj', 'data.table' and 'data.frame':\t90 obs. of  4 variables:   $ region   : chr  "Total" "Total" "Total" "Total" ...                        $ var1     : chr  "Total" "annet" "arbeid" "soshjelp" ...                    $ Freq     : num  706 88 54 342 222 127 14 11 64 38 ...                      $ sdcStatus: chr  "s" "s" "s" "s" ...                                        - attr(*, ".internal.selfref")=<externalptr>                                NULL                                                                         ==========                                                                   Classes 'safeObj', 'data.table' and 'data.frame':\t70 obs. of  4 variables:   $ region   : chr  "Total" "Total" "Total" "Total" ...                        $ var1     : chr  "Total" "annet" "arbeid" "soshjelp" ...                    $ Freq     : num  706 88 54 342 222 596 72 52 283 189 ...                    $ sdcStatus: chr  "s" "s" "s" "s" ...                                        - attr(*, ".internal.selfref")=<externalptr>                                NULL

title: The problem of singletons and zeros in 'easySdcTable'
text: document discuss background changes made easySdcTable parameter threshold introduced new possibility sdcTable.
code: library(easySdcTable)

title: The problem of singletons and zeros in 'easySdcTable'
text: four two-way example datasets. data organized wide format frequencies several columns. thus one row variable one column variable. dataset, data1b, comes Kristian Lønø. used point problem led changes latest version r-package sdcTable. details document. datasets modified variants. data1a data1b data0a data0b

title: The problem of singletons and zeros in 'easySdcTable'
text: first run first dataset, use protectZeros = FALSE. means 0s suppressed. 0s shown none secondary suppressed. use (previously) usual method, "SIMPLEHEURISTIC_OLD". s1a easy reveal suppressed numbers first row must 1 since sum 9 neither number can 0. called singleton problem. underlying function sdcTable parameter, detectSingletons (default FALSE), intended handle problem. parameters sdcTable can also used input ProtectTable. s1aSingle Now sufficiently suppressed values can longer revealed. next dataset different. s1bSingle can reveal suppressed numbers first row must 1. problem led changes latest version sdcTable. new parameter, threshold, introduced.
code: s1a = ProtectTable(data1a, 1, 2:6, protectZeros = FALSE,  method = "SIMPLEHEURISTIC_OLD", suppression=".")$suppressed s1aSingle = ProtectTable(data1a, 1, 2:6, protectZeros = FALSE,  method = "SIMPLEHEURISTIC_OLD", detectSingletons=TRUE,                          suppression=".")$suppressed s1bSingle = ProtectTable(data1b, 1, 2:6, protectZeros = FALSE,  method = "SIMPLEHEURISTIC_OLD", detectSingletons=TRUE,                          suppression=".")$suppressed

what: Solving the singleton problem by using threshold
title: The problem of singletons and zeros in 'easySdcTable'
text: new parameter, threshold, number can specified. parameter means sum suppressed cells required least threshold. means threshold = 3 solve problems similar way detectSingletons = TRUE. case data1b, problem solved since sum already 3. problem can solved setting threshold = 4. s1bThreshold4 Now suppressed sufficiently. problem one know, without examining data, threshold needed. difficult create example data threshold = 4 enough. One imagine large value threshold. threshold parameter affects 1s also suppressed numbers. , 7s first row removed, also 8s second row. might required. possible know must 1 2 row, complete disclosure. imagined example 4 secondary suppressed protect 2, extra cells suppressed threshold = 7. , parameter threshold solve singleton problem optimal way. shown , looks better case zeros suppressed.
code: s1bThreshold4 = ProtectTable(data1b, 1, 2:6, protectZeros = FALSE,  method = "SIMPLEHEURISTIC_OLD", threshold=4,                          suppression=".")$suppressed

title: The problem of singletons and zeros in 'easySdcTable'
text: Now consider data0a use protectZeros = TRUE. means 0s primary suppressed. s0a easy reveal suppressed numbers first row must 0 since sum numbers shown already 21. problem similar problem 1s, called singleton problem. doesn’t help using detectSingletons = TRUE. answer . next data set (data0b) three 0’s problem . s0b
code: s0a = ProtectTable(data0a, 1, 2:6, protectZeros = TRUE,  method = "SIMPLEHEURISTIC_OLD", suppression=".")$suppressed s0b = ProtectTable(data0b, 1, 2:6, protectZeros = TRUE,  method = "SIMPLEHEURISTIC_OLD", suppression=".")$suppressed

what: Solving the problem of zeros by using threshold=1
title: The problem of singletons and zeros in 'easySdcTable'
text: threshold parameter solves problem (data0a). sufficient set threshold = 1 prevent 0s suppressed. s0aThreshold1 three (, data0b) zeros, problem also solved. suppressed extra avoid disclosure. s0bThreshold1
code: s0aThreshold1 = ProtectTable(data0a, 1, 2:6, protectZeros = TRUE,  method = "SIMPLEHEURISTIC_OLD", threshold = 1, suppression=".")$suppressed s0bThreshold1 = ProtectTable(data0b, 1, 2:6, protectZeros = TRUE,  method = "SIMPLEHEURISTIC_OLD", threshold = 1, suppression=".")$suppressed

title: The problem of singletons and zeros in 'easySdcTable'
text: new parameter threshold optimal solution singleton problem (1s). Users must consider value use. great threshold parameter solves problems 0’s, ie protectZeros = TRUE. Note also threshold parameter can used increase degree protection general, even without 0s 1s. easySdcTable, protectZeros = TRUE default. sdcTable. parameter also renamed. method "SIMPLEHEURISTIC" default sdcTable, also default easySdcTable. now changed "SimpleSingle" whos new definition : protectZeros=FALSE: "SIMPLEHEURISTIC" detectSingletons=TRUE. protectZeros=TRUE: "SIMPLEHEURISTIC" threshold=1 (can overridden input). problem zeros solved. Otherwise, data protected old way using detectSingletons. addition, possible manually set parameter threshold provide better protection. done, parameter detectSingletons used. Note parameters detectSingletons threshold increase computing time.

title: The problem of singletons and zeros in 'easySdcTable'
text: Method "Gauss" made default (See NEWS). examples still relevant, "SIMPLEHEURISTIC_OLD" used instead "SIMPLEHEURISTIC". solution threshold=1, cells earlier (needed) suppressed. Methodology handle problem singletons zeros also included “Gauss” . output: s1aGauss s1bGauss s0aGauss s0bGauss
code: s1aGauss = ProtectTable(data1a, 1, 2:6, protectZeros = FALSE, suppression=".")$suppressed s1bGauss = ProtectTable(data1b, 1, 2:6, protectZeros = FALSE, suppression=".")$suppressed s0aGauss = ProtectTable(data0a, 1, 2:6, protectZeros = TRUE,  suppression=".")$suppressed s0bGauss = ProtectTable(data0b, 1, 2:6, protectZeros = TRUE,  suppression=".")$suppressed

title: Authors and Citation
text: Øyvind Langsrud. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Langsrud Ø (2025). easySdcTable: Easy Interface Statistical Disclosure Control Package 'sdcTable' Extended Implementation 'GaussSuppression'. R package version 1.0.7, https://statisticsnorway.github.io/ssb-easysdctable/, https://github.com/statisticsnorway/easySdcTable.
code: @Manual{,   title = {easySdcTable: Easy Interface to the Statistical Disclosure Control Package 'sdcTable' Extended with Own Implementation of 'GaussSuppression'},   author = {Øyvind Langsrud},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.7, https://statisticsnorway.github.io/ssb-easysdctable/},   url = {https://github.com/statisticsnorway/easySdcTable}, }

title: Default IncProgress function — IncDefault
text: Instead using IncProgress = IncDefault ProtectTable1/ProtectTable one use IncProgress = function(){cat("."); flush.console()}  results wrong "usage line" documentation since ";" included.

title: Table suppression - Shiny Gui — PTgui
text: Run PTgui R console use PTguiApp make server application

title: Table suppression - Shiny Gui — PTgui
code: PTgui(   data = NULL,   language = "English",   exeArgus = NULL,   pathArgus = getwd(),   maxNchoices = c(1:10, 12, 15, 20),   ... )  PTguiApp(   language = "English",   exeArgus = NULL,   pathArgus = "",   maxNchoices = c(1:10, 12, 15, 20),   ... )  PTguiNO(   data = NULL,   language = "Norwegian",   exeArgus = NULL,   pathArgus = getwd(),   maxNchoices = c(1:10, 12, 15, 20),   ... )  PTguiAppNO(   language = "Norwegian",   exeArgus = NULL,   pathArgus = "",   maxNchoices = c(1:10, 12, 15, 20),   ... )

text: data NULL data.frame language Menu language, "English" "Norwegian". exeArgus Tau-argus executable pathArgus Folder (temporary) tau-argus files maxNchoices Choices maxN ... parameters sent ProtectTable

title: Table suppression - Shiny Gui — PTgui
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{    # Start the gui. PTgui()  # Start Norwegian gui with example data and catch output out <- PTguiNO(data=EasyData("z1w"))     # Note: Change to TauArgus.exe-path in your computer exeArgus <- "C:/TauArgus4.2.0b2/TauArgus.exe"  # Note: Change to an existing folder  pathArgus <- "C:/Users/nnn/Documents"      # Start the gui with possibility to run tau-argus.        PTgui(exeArgus=exeArgus, pathArgus=pathArgus)           } # }

what: Wrapper to ProtectTable() with additional methods (partly experimental) — PTwrap
title: Wrapper to ProtectTable() with additional methods (partly experimental) — PTwrap
text: Additional values "method" possible. new method (wrapper method) make call  ProtectTable() using specific parameter setting.

title: Wrapper to ProtectTable() with additional methods (partly experimental) — PTwrap
code: PTwrap(   ...,   maxN = 3,   method = "SimpleSingle",   exeArgus = "C:/Tau/TauArgus.exe",   pathArgus = getwd(),   solverArgus = "FREE",   methodArgus = "OPT",   rgArgus = 0 )

title: Wrapper to ProtectTable() with additional methods (partly experimental) — PTwrap
text: ... Parameters ProtectTable maxN Parameter ProtectTable method Parameter ProtectTable wrapper method (see details) exeArgus Parameter runArgusBatchFile pathArgus Parameter createArgusInput solverArgus Parameter "solver" createArgusInput methodArgus Parameter "method" createArgusInput rgArgus Parameter "rg" "primSuppRules" createArgusInput

title: Wrapper to ProtectTable() with additional methods (partly experimental) — PTwrap
text: See ProtectTable

title: Wrapper to ProtectTable() with additional methods (partly experimental) — PTwrap
text: wrapper methods : Simple:  "SIMPLEHEURISTIC" detectSingletons=FALSE SimpleSingle: "SIMPLEHEURISTIC" detectSingletons=TRUE protectZeros=FALSE                            "SIMPLEHEURISTIC" threshold=1 (can overridden input) protectZeros=TRUE SimpleSingleOld: "SIMPLEHEURISTIC" detectSingletons=TRUE TauArgus: Tau-argus run according settings input parameters. Using rgArgus=0 equivalent calling ProtectTable() method = list(exe=exeArgus, typ="tabular", path=pathArgus, solver=solverArgus, method=methodArgus))) values rgArgus equivalent calling ProtectTable() method = list(exe=exeArgus, typ="microdata", path=pathArgus,solver=solverArgus, method=methodArgus,primSuppRules=list(list(type="freq", n=maxN+1, rg=rgArgus ))))) TauArgusOPT: "TauArgus" methodArgus="OPT" TauArgusMOD: "TauArgus" methodArgus="MOD" TauArgusGH:  "TauArgus" methodArgus="GH"

what: ProtectTable with output ready for SuppressDec in package RegSDC — PTxyz
title: ProtectTable with output ready for SuppressDec in package RegSDC — PTxyz
text: Assuming correct suppression, suppressed values become decimal numbers (whole numbers) instead missing.

title: ProtectTable with output ready for SuppressDec in package RegSDC — PTxyz
code: PTxyz(data, dimVar, freqVar, ...)

title: ProtectTable with output ready for SuppressDec in package RegSDC — PTxyz
text: data data frame dimVar main dimensional variables additional aggregating variables (name number). freqVar Variable(s) holding counts (name number). ... parameters sent ProtectTable

title: ProtectTable with output ready for SuppressDec in package RegSDC — PTxyz
text: List three matrices ready input SuppressDec x Sparse dummy matrix dimensions match z y. z Frequencies published suppressed NA. y Inner cell frequencies.

title: ProtectTable with output ready for SuppressDec in package RegSDC — PTxyz
text: Within r package function used testing

title: ProtectTable with output ready for SuppressDec in package RegSDC — PTxyz
text: Øyvind Langsrud

title: ProtectTable with output ready for SuppressDec in package RegSDC — PTxyz
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  # Same examples as in ProtectTable  a1 <- PTxyz(EasyData("z1"), c("region","hovedint") ,"ant") a2 <- PTxyz(EasyData("z2"), c(1,3,4),5)    if (require(RegSDC)) { # RegSDCdata and SuppressDec   # Same data as in RegSDCdata examples (and in paper)   data7 <- RegSDCdata("sec7data")   data7 <- data7[!is.na(data7$y), 1:3]   data7    # Generate x, y, z similar to xAll, y, zAllSupp in RegSDCdata examples    # But different suppressed cells and z ordered differently   a <- PTxyz(data7, 1:2, 3, maxN = 3, method = "HITAS")   a    # Suppressed inner cells as decimal numbers   yDec <- SuppressDec(a$x, a$z, a$y, rmse = 1)   yDec    # All cells as decimal numbers   cbind(a$z, t(a$x) %*% cbind(a$y, yDec))    # As ProtectTable example   z1 <- EasyData("z1")   a <- PTxyz(z1, c("region", "hovedint"), "ant")    # Inner cells as decimal numbers. 3 replicates.   yDec <- SuppressDec(a$x, a$z, a$y, nRep = 3)   yDec    # All cells with 3 replicates.   cbind(a$z, t(a$x) %*% cbind(a$y, yDec)) }  if (require(RegSDC)) {   # An example involving two linked tables.     # It is demonstrated that the SIMPLEHEURISTIC approach to suppression is not safe.     # That is, perfect fit (whole numbers) for some suppressed cells.   a <- PTxyz(EasyData("z3"), 1:5, 7, method = "SIMPLEHEURISTIC", protectZeros= FALSE)   cbind(a$z, t(a$x) %*% cbind(a$y, SuppressDec(a$x, a$z, rmse=pi/3, nRep=3)))[which(is.na(a$z)), ] }} # }

what: Easy interface to sdcTable: Table suppression according to a frequency rule. — ProtectTable
title: Easy interface to sdcTable: Table suppression according to a frequency rule. — ProtectTable
text: GaussSuppression, protectTable  protect_linked_tables run data set required input. One (stacked) several (unstacked) input variables can hold cell counts. ProtectTableData tidy wrapper function, returns single data frame instead list (info omitted).

title: Easy interface to sdcTable: Table suppression according to a frequency rule. — ProtectTable
code: ProtectTable(   data,   dimVar = 1:NCOL(data),   freqVar = NULL,   protectZeros = TRUE,   maxN = 3,   method = "Gauss",   findLinked = TRUE,   total = "Total",   addName = FALSE,   sep = "_",   removeZeros = FALSE,   dimList = NULL,   groupVarInd = NULL,   ind1 = NULL,   ind2 = NULL,   rowData = NULL,   varNames = paste("var", 1:100, sep = ""),   split = NULL,   border = sep,   revBorder = FALSE,   freqName = "values",   totalFirst = FALSE,   numericOrder = TRUE,   namesAsInput = TRUE,   orderAsInput = TRUE,   sortByReversedColumns = FALSE,   doUnstack = TRUE,   removeTotal = TRUE,   singleOutput = NULL,   suppression = NA,   outFreq = "freq",   outSdcStatus = "sdcStatus",   outSuppressed = "suppressed",   infoAsFrame = FALSE,   IncProgress = IncDefault,   verbose = FALSE,   ... )  ProtectTableData(data, ...)

title: Easy interface to sdcTable: Table suppression according to a frequency rule. — ProtectTable
text: data data frame dimVar main dimensional variables additional aggregating variables (name number). freqVar Variable(s) holding counts NULL case micro data (name number). protectZeros TRUE empty cells (count=0) considered sensitive (.e. allowZeros  primarySuppression). maxN cells counts <= maxN set primary suppressed. method Parameter method protectTable, protect_linked_tables wrapper methods via PTwrap. Gauss (default) implemented independently sdcTable. also similar variant implemented sdcTable GAUSS. implementation optimal Gauss recommended instead. "SIMPLEHEURISTIC": method default protectable. "SIMPLEHEURISTIC_OLD": "SIMPLEHEURISTIC" sdcTable versions prior 0.32. "OPT", "HITAS", "HYPERCUBE", "GAUSS": methods protectable. "HYPERCUBE" possible cases two linked tables. "SimpleSingle":  "SIMPLEHEURISTIC_OLD" detectSingletons=TRUE protectZeros=FALSE "SIMPLEHEURISTIC_OLD" threshold=1 (can overridden input) protectZeros=TRUE. "SIMPLEHEURISTICSingle": "SimpleSingle" "SIMPLEHEURISTIC" instead "SIMPLEHEURISTIC_OLD". "Simple": "SIMPLEHEURISTIC_OLD" detectSingletons=FALSE. "Gauss": GaussSuppression called parameters x, candidates, primary singleton automatically generated. parameters (singletonMethod, printInc) can specified. Alternatively parameter can named list specifying parameters running tau-argus (see details). See PTwrap (experimental) wrapper methods (see details). findLinked TRUE, function may find two linked tables run protect_linked_tables. total String used name totals. addName TRUE variable name added level names, except variables levels. sep character string separate addName apply creating variable names. removeZeros TRUE, rows zero count removed data within algorithm. dimList default, hierarchies automatically found data (see FindDimLists). non-NULL dimList, changed. practice done function ReplaceDimList. groupVarInd Possible manual specification list defining hierarchical variable groups. NULL (default) information found automatically FindTableGroup. ind1 Coding table 1 indices referring elements groupVarInd. information found automatically FindTableGroup groupVarInd=NULL. ind2 Coding table 2 indices referring elements groupVarInd (ind1 ). rowData Input Stack used generate extra dimVar variables stacking cases several freqvar variables. NULL rowData created automatically AutoSplit using varNames (see ) freqvar names input. varNames names extra dimVar variable(s) made stacking cases several freqvar variables. length(varNames)>1 several variables may found AutoSplit. split Parameter AutoSplit - see varNames rowData . NULL (default), automatic splitting without needing split string. border Parameter AutoSplit - see varNames rowData . revBorder Parameter AutoSplit - see varNames rowData .. freqName Input Stack. name new freqvar variable obtained stacking cases several input freqvar variables. totalFirst Parameter controlling output sorted. numericOrder Parameter controlling output sorted. Output character sorting can based numeric input variables. namesAsInput TRUE output variables (created unstacking) correspond input named input. orderAsInput TRUE output corresponding input ordered input kept together one block. sortByReversedColumns TRUE output sorted variables opposite order. doUnstack FALSE output unstacked (cases sever input freqvar variables) removeTotal TRUE total string (see total ) removed names output variables created unstacking (cases sever input freqvar variables). singleOutput TRUE output single data set. Default FALSE unstacked data (cases sever input freqvar variables) otherwise TRUE. suppression Value used suppressed elements suppressed output data. Default NA. outFreq String used name output variable(s) outSdcStatus String used name output variable(s) outSuppressed String used name output variable(s) infoAsFrame TRUE output element info data frame (useful Shiny). IncProgress function report progress (incProgress Shiny). Set equal NULL turn . verbose Parameter sent protectTable, protect_linked_tables runArgusBatchFile. ... parameters sent protectTable (possibly via protect_linked_tables) timeLimit. Parameters  GaussSuppression, createArgusInput PTwrap also possible (see details).

title: Easy interface to sdcTable: Table suppression according to a frequency rule. — ProtectTable
text: singleOutput=TRUE output list two elements. info: Information single column character matrix. information extra dimVar variables created stacking, information identified (linked) table(s) summary output sdcTable. method="Gauss", sdcTable function run maxN=0 create template real output. summary info therefore misleading case. data: data frame variables named according outFreq, outSdcStatus outSuppressed. singleOutput=FALSE output element data replaced three elements named according outFreq, outSdcStatus outSuppressed.

title: Easy interface to sdcTable: Table suppression according to a frequency rule. — ProtectTable
text: One two tables identified automatically subjected cell suppression protectTable (single table) protect_linked_tables (two linked tables). tables can alternatively specified manually groupVarInd, ind1 ind2. output form similiar input depending whether freqVar single variable . status cells coded  "u" (primary suppressed), "x" (secondary suppression), "s" (can published). taken directly output sdcTable. cases two linked tables "u" "x" common cells based output first table. run tau-argus specify method named list containing parameter exe runArgusBatchFile parameters createArgusInput. One may specify: method = list(exe="C:/Tau/TauArgus.exe", typ="tabular", path= getwd(), solver= "FREE", method= "OPT") However values "exe", "path" "solver" "method" set default case using "method = list(typ="tabular", method= "OPT")" equivalent. typ="microdata" specified. Necessary transformation microdata made. Wrapper methods (partly experimental): function PTwrap several additional methods defined. input ProtectTable() one methods ProtectTable() run via PTwrap(). making explicit call PTwrap() needed. Singleton zeros: parameter detectSingletons included protecttable handle -called singleton problem appers  protectZeros=FALSE. problems solved parameter threshold introduced later. value threshold needed depends number singletons one group. seems threshold=3 equivalent detectSingletons=TRUE. protectZeros=TRUE related “zero problem” occurs. problem solved threshold=1. NOTE: use numVarInd, weightInd sampWeightInd sdcTable implemented. also limit possible input  tau-argus.

title: Easy interface to sdcTable: Table suppression according to a frequency rule. — ProtectTable
text: ProtectTable makes call function ProtectTable1.

title: Easy interface to sdcTable: Table suppression according to a frequency rule. — ProtectTable
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   # ==== Example 1 , 8 regions ====  z1 <- EasyData("z1")          ProtectTable(z1,1:2, 3)  ProtectTableData(z1,1:2, 3)  ProtectTable(z1, c("region","hovedint"), "ant") # Input by name   # --- Unstacked input data ---  z1w = EasyData("z1w")   ProtectTable(z1w, 1, 2:5)  ProtectTableData(z1w, 1, 2:5)  ProtectTable(z1w, 1, 2:5, varName="hovedint")   ProtectTable(z1w, 1, 2:5, method="HITAS")  ProtectTable(z1w, 1, 2:5, totalFirst = TRUE, method ="Simple")    # ==== Example 2 , 11 regions ====  z2 <- EasyData("z2")   ProtectTable(z2,c(1,3,4), 5) # With region-variable kostragr  # --- Unstacked input data ---  z2w <- EasyData("z2w")   ProtectTable(z2w, 1:2, 4:7) # With region-variable fylke  ProtectTable(z2w, 1:3, 4:7) # Two linked tables    # ==== Example 3 , 36 regions ====  z3 <- EasyData("z3")     ProtectTable(z3, c(1,4,5), 7)                               # Three dimensions. No subtotals      ProtectTable(z3, 1:6, 7)                                    # Two linked tables    # --- Unstacked input data with coded column names   z3w <- EasyData("z3w")  ProtectTable(z3w,1:3,4:15, varName="g12")                   # coding not used when single varName  ProtectTable(z3w,1:3,4:15, varName=c("hovedint","mnd"))     # Two variables found automatically   ProtectTable(z3w,1:3,4:15, varName=c("hovedint","mnd"),                removeTotal=FALSE)                            # Keep "Total" in variable names   # --- Unstacked input data with three level column name coding  z3wb <- EasyData("z3wb")    ProtectTable(z3wb,1:3,4:15,varName=c("hovedint","mnd","mnd2")) # Two variables found automatically  ProtectTable(z3wb,1:3,4:15,varName=c("hovedint","mnd","mnd2"),               split="_")                                         # Three variables when splitting  ProtectTable(z3wb,1:3,4:15,varName=c("hovedint","mnd","mnd2"),                split="_",namesAsInput=FALSE,orderAsInput=FALSE) # Alternative ouput format                  # ====  Examples Tau-Argus ====                exeArgus <- "C:/TauArgus4.1.4/TauArgus.exe" # Change to TauArgus.exe-path in your computer  pathArgus <- "C:/Users/nnn/Documents"       # Change to an existing folder   z1 = EasyData("z1")   ProtectTable(z1,1:2,3,method=list(exe=exeArgus, path=pathArgus, typ="tabular", method="OPT"))   ProtectTable(z1,1:2,3,method=list(exe=exeArgus, path=pathArgus, typ="tabular", method="MOD"))   ProtectTable(z1,1:2,3,method=list(exe=exeArgus, path=pathArgus, typ="tabular", method="GH"))   ProtectTable(z1,1:2,3,maxN=-1,    method=list(path=pathArgus, exe=exeArgus, method="OPT",          primSuppRules= list(list(type="freq", n=4, rg=20))))  z3 <- EasyData("z3")  ProtectTable(z3,c(1:2,4,5),7,maxN=-1,    method=list(path=pathArgus, exe=exeArgus, method="OPT",          primSuppRules=list(list(type="freq", n=4, rg=20))))                           # ==== Examples with parameter dimList  ==== z2 <- EasyData("z2") dList <- FindDimLists(z2[-5]) ProtectTable(z2[, c(1,4,5)], 1:2, 3, dimList = dList[c(1,3)]) ProtectTable(z2[, c(1,4,5)], 1:2, 3, dimList = dList[2]) ProtectTable(z2[, c(1,4,5)], 1:2, 3, dimList = DimList2Hrc(dList[c(2,3)])) } # }

what: Easy input interface to sdcTable — ProtectTable1
title: Easy input interface to sdcTable — ProtectTable1
text: protectTable protect_linked_tables run data set required input.

title: Easy input interface to sdcTable — ProtectTable1
code: ProtectTable1(   data,   dimVarInd = 1:NCOL(data),   freqVarInd = NULL,   protectZeros = TRUE,   maxN = 3,   method = "SIMPLEHEURISTIC",   findLinked = TRUE,   total = "Total",   addName = FALSE,   sep = ".",   removeZeros = FALSE,   dimList = NULL,   groupVarInd = NULL,   ind1 = NULL,   ind2 = NULL,   dimDataReturn = FALSE,   IncProgress = IncDefault,   verbose = FALSE,   ... )

title: Easy input interface to sdcTable — ProtectTable1
text: data Matrix data frame dimVarInd Column-indices main dimensional variables additional aggregating variables. freqVarInd Column-indices variable holding counts NULL case micro data. protectZeros TRUE empty cells (count=0) considered sensitive (.e. allowZeros primarySuppression). maxN cells counts <= maxN set primary suppressed. method Parameter "method" protectTable protect_linked_tables. Alternatively list defining parameters running tau-argus (see ProtectTable). findLinked TRUE, function may find two linked tables run protect_linked_tables. total String used name totals. addName TRUE variable name added level names, except variables levels. sep character string separate addName apply. removeZeros TRUE, rows zero count removed data. dimList See ProtectTable. groupVarInd Possible manual specification list defining hierarchical variable groups ind1 Coding table 1 indices referring elements groupVarInd ind2 Coding table 2 indices referring elements groupVarInd dimDataReturn TRUE data frame containing dimVarInd variables retuned IncProgress function report progress (incProgress Shiny). verbose Parameter sent protectTable, protect_linked_tables runArgusBatchFile. ... parameters sent protectTable, protect_linked_tables createArgusInput.

title: Easy input interface to sdcTable — ProtectTable1
text: Output list three elements. table1 consists following elements: secondary Output protectTable first element output protect_linked_tables         output runArgusBatchFile. primary Output primarySuppression. problem Output makeProblem. dimList Generated input makeProblem. ind Indices referring elements groupVarInd output element common. table2 consists elements type table1 cases two linked tables. Otherwise  table2 NULL. common consists following elements: commonCells Input protect_linked_tables. groupVarInd List defining hierarchical variable groups info table summarizing tables using variable names nLevels number levels variable (groupVarInd input NULL) dimData Data frame containing dimVarInd variables dimDataReturn=TRUE. Otherwise NULL.

title: Easy input interface to sdcTable — ProtectTable1
text: One two tables identified automatically subjected cell suppression methods package sdcTable.          tables can alternatively specified manually groupVarInd, ind1 ind2 (see FindTableGroup).

title: Easy input interface to sdcTable — ProtectTable1
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ z2 <- EasyData("z2") a <- ProtectTable1(z2, c(1, 3, 4), 5) head(as.data.frame(sdcTable::getInfo(a[[1]][[1]], type = "finalData"))) # The table (not linked)  z3 <- EasyData("z3") b <- ProtectTable1(z3, 1:6, 7) head(as.data.frame(sdcTable::getInfo(b[[1]][[1]], type = "finalData"))) # First table head(as.data.frame(sdcTable::getInfo(b[[2]][[1]], type = "finalData"))) # Second table } # }

title: ReplaceDimList — ReplaceDimList
code: # First generate dimLists dimListA <- FindDimLists(SSBtoolsData("sprt_emp_withEU")[, c("geo", "eu", "age")]) dimListB <- FindDimLists(SSBtoolsData("sprt_emp_withEU")[, c("geo", "age")]) dimListC <- FindDimLists(SSBtoolsData("sprt_emp_withEU")[, c("geo", "eu")])  # dimListA1 and dimListA are identical dimListA1 <- ReplaceDimList(dimListB, dimListC) identical(dimListA, dimListA1) #> [1] TRUE  # replaceList can be TauArgus coded hcrC <- DimList2Hrc(dimListC)  # dimListA2 and dimListA are identical dimListA2 <- ReplaceDimList(dimListB, hcrC) identical(dimListA, dimListA2) #> [1] TRUE  # Also possible when duplicated names ReplaceDimList(FindDimLists(EasyData("z3")[, -7]),                 FindDimLists(EasyData("z2")[, -5])) #> $region #>    levels codes #> 1       @ Total #> 2      @@     1 #> 3     @@@     A #> 4     @@@     I #> 5      @@     4 #> 6     @@@     B #> 7      @@     5 #> 8     @@@     C #> 9     @@@     D #> 10     @@     6 #> 11    @@@     E #> 12    @@@     F #> 13     @@     8 #> 14    @@@     G #> 15    @@@     H #> 16     @@    10 #> 17    @@@     J #> 18    @@@     K #>  #> $region #>    levels codes #> 1       @ Total #> 2      @@   300 #> 3     @@@     A #> 4     @@@     B #> 5     @@@     C #> 6     @@@     D #> 7     @@@     E #> 8     @@@     F #> 9     @@@     G #> 10    @@@     H #> 11     @@   400 #> 12    @@@     I #> 13    @@@     J #> 14    @@@     K #>  #> $hovedint #>   levels    codes #> 1      @    Total #> 2     @@    annet #> 3     @@   arbeid #> 4     @@ soshjelp #> 5     @@    trygd #>  #> $mnd #>   levels  codes #> 1      @  Total #> 2     @@ M01M05 #> 3    @@@ m01m05 #> 4     @@ M06M12 #> 5    @@@ m06m09 #> 6    @@@ m10m12 #>

title: easySdcTable 1.0.7
text: CRAN release: 2022-12-22 Data pre-aggregated prior Gauss algorithm. Efficiency improved. also improves singleton handling protectZeros = FALSE.

title: easySdcTable 1.0.3
text: CRAN release: 2022-03-22 Note comment “Gauss” zeros omitted input “Introduction ‘easySdcTable’”

title: easySdcTable 1.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-01-03 examples still relevant, "SIMPLEHEURISTIC_OLD" used instead "SIMPLEHEURISTIC".

title: easySdcTable 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-10-11 Possible introduction “SIMPLEHEURISTIC_OLD” sdcTable 0.32.1 Ensures behavior sdcTable versions prior 0.32. Thus, “SimpleSingle” “Simple” behave earlier (see problems 0.8.0 news ). “SimpleSingle” “SIMPLEHEURISTIC” instead “SIMPLEHEURISTIC_OLD”

title: easySdcTable 0.9.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-09-10 potential pitfall secondary suppression Gaussian elimination cases protectZeros = TRUE zeros omitted input data. underlying function, GaussSuppression, produce warning cases (introduced SSBtools version 1.2.2) text: “Suppressed cells empty input protected. Extend input data zeros?”. Cases warning occur now avoided within ProtectTable. Internally data automatically extended needed.

title: easySdcTable 0.8.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-08-12 Based comparison computing times, errors numbers suppressed revealed cells, natural consequence release sdcTable version 0.32.0 (see comparison/Comparison suppression methods developing easySdcTable ver. 0.8.0.md github page easySdcTable). Now protect_linked_tables used insetad protectLinkedTables Summary output sdcTable captured differently (info output) New tidy wrapper function, ProtectTableData, returns single data frame.

title: easySdcTable 0.7.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-05-20 changes functionality. technical changes minor improvements.

title: easySdcTable 0.6.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-07-27 additional method available sdcTable Secondary suppression Gaussian elimination Version 0.5.0 resulted wrong tau-argus input useFancyQuotes option TRUE.

title: easySdcTable 0.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-04-04 new parameter, threshold, sdcTable used. Run PTgui R console use PTguiApp make server application ProtectTable output ready SuppressDec package RegSDC

title: easySdcTable 0.3.3
text: CRAN release: 2019-02-20 Last version news
